org.opends.sdk.ldap
Class LDAPConnectionOptions

java.lang.Object
  org.opends.sdk.ldap.LDAPConnectionOptions

public final class LDAPConnectionOptions
extends Object

Common connection options for LDAP connections.

Method Detail

copyOf

public static LDAPConnectionOptions copyOf(LDAPConnectionOptions options)
Creates a copy of the provided connection options.

Parameters:
options - The options to be copied.
Returns:
The copy of the provided connection options.

defaultOptions

public static LDAPConnectionOptions defaultOptions()
Creates a new set of connection options with default settings. SSL will not be enabled, nor will key or trust managers be defined.

Returns:
The new connection options.

getSchema

public Schema getSchema()
Returns the schema which will be used to decode responses from the server. By default the schema returned by Schema.getDefaultSchema() will be used.

Returns:
The schema which will be used to decode responses from the server.

setSchema

public LDAPConnectionOptions setSchema(Schema schema)
                                throws NullPointerException
Sets the schema which will be used to decode responses from the server. By default the schema returned by Schema.getDefaultSchema() will be used.

Parameters:
schema - The schema which will be used to decode responses from the server.
Returns:
A reference to this LDAP connection options.
Throws:
NullPointerException - If schema was null.

getSSLContext

public SSLContext getSSLContext()
Returns the SSL context which will be used when initiating connections with the Directory Server. By default no SSL context will be used, indicating that connections will not be secured. If a non-null SSL context is returned then connections will be secured using either SSL or StartTLS depending on useStartTLS().

Returns:
The SSL context which will be used when initiating secure connections with the Directory Server, which may be null indicating that connections will not be secured.

setSSLContext

public LDAPConnectionOptions setSSLContext(SSLContext sslContext)
Sets the SSL context which will be used when initiating connections with the Directory Server. By default no SSL context will be used, indicating that connections will not be secured. If a non-null SSL context is returned then connections will be secured using either SSL or StartTLS depending on useStartTLS().

Parameters:
sslContext - The SSL context which will be used when initiating secure connections with the Directory Server, which may be null indicating that connections will not be secured.
Returns:
A reference to this LDAP connection options.

useStartTLS

public boolean useStartTLS()
Indicates whether or not SSL or StartTLS should be used for securing connections when an SSL context is specified. By default SSL will be used in preference to StartTLS.

Returns:
true if StartTLS should be used for securing connections when an SSL context is specified, otherwise false indicating that SSL should be used.

setUseStartTLS

public LDAPConnectionOptions setUseStartTLS(boolean useStartTLS)
Specifies whether or not SSL or StartTLS should be used for securing connections when an SSL context is specified. By default SSL will be used in preference to StartTLS.

Parameters:
useStartTLS - true if StartTLS should be used for securing connections when an SSL context is specified, otherwise false indicating that SSL should be used.
Returns:
A reference to this LDAP connection options.
